data.proposal:
# 4-Day Family-Trip (Vacation) Itinerary for Marrakech

## Overview
This 4-day family-trip itinerary is designed for a couple and children aged 8 and 10. The travelers are interested in beach lounging, snorkeling, sunset cruise, wildlife watching, and guided tours.

## Day 1

### Morning (8:00 AM - 12:00 PM)
- Breakfast at Café Arabe (9:00 AM - 10:00 AM), a local restaurant serving traditional Moroccan cuisine
- Visit Jardin Majorelle (10:30 AM - 12:00 PM), a botanical garden founded by French artist Jacques Majorelle and later acquired by Yves Saint Laurent
- Travel time to the next location: approximately 15 minutes

### Afternoon (12:00 PM - 5:00 PM)
- Lunch at Le Comptoir Dari (1:00 PM - 2:30 PM), a cozy restaurant serving French-inspired Moroccan cuisine
- Visit Bahia Palace (3:00 PM - 4:30 PM), a palace built in the late 19th century and featuring an impressive blend of Islamic, Arab, and Berber architectural styles
- Travel time to the next location: approximately 10 minutes

### Evening (5:00 PM - 10:00 PM)
- Dinner at La Bodeguita del Meditteraneo (7:00 PM - 8:30 PM), a restaurant serving Mediterranean cuisine in a cozy setting
- Watch the sunset at Place Hassan II (9:00 PM - 10:00 PM), a public square with stunning views of the Atlas Mountains

## Day 2

### Morning (8:00 AM - 12:00 PM)
- Breakfast at Café des Arts (9:00 AM - 10:00 AM), a café serving traditional Moroccan pastries and coffee
- Visit Marrakech Museum (10:30 AM - 12:00 PM), a museum showcasing the history and culture of Marrakech
- Travel time to the next location: approximately 15 minutes

### Afternoon (12:00 PM - 5:00 PM)
- Lunch at Le Grand Café (1:00 PM - 2:30 PM), a restaurant serving French-inspired cuisine in a historic setting
- Visit Majorelle Garden's Bird Sanctuary (3:00 PM - 4:30 PM), a sanctuary featuring a wide variety of bird species
- Travel time to the next location: approximately 10 minutes

### Evening (5:00 PM - 10:00 PM)
- Dinner at Restaurant Le Tobsyat (7:00 PM - 8:30 PM), a restaurant serving traditional Moroccan cuisine in a cozy setting
- Enjoy a relaxing evening stroll through the medina, exploring its narrow streets and alleys

## Day 3

### Morning (8:00 AM - 12:00 PM)
- Breakfast at Café Clock (9:00 AM - 10:00 AM), a café serving traditional Moroccan breakfast dishes
- Visit Saadian Tombs (10:30 AM - 12:00 PM), a historical site featuring the tombs of several sultans from the Saadian dynasty
- Travel time to the next location: approximately 15 minutes

### Afternoon (12:00 PM - 5:00 PM)
- Lunch at Le Pain Quotidien (1:00 PM - 2:30 PM), a restaurant serving organic and natural cuisine in a cozy setting
- Visit Dar Si Said Museum (3:00 PM - 4:30 PM), a museum showcasing traditional Moroccan arts and crafts
- Travel time to the next location: approximately 10 minutes

### Evening (5:00 PM - 10:00 PM)
- Dinner at Restaurant Le Comptoir de la Gare (7:00 PM - 8:30 PM), a restaurant serving French-inspired cuisine in a historic setting
- Enjoy a relaxing evening cruise on the Lake Imlil, taking in the breathtaking views of the Atlas Mountains

## Day 4

### Morning (8:00 AM - 12:00 PM)
- Breakfast at Café des Arts (9:00 AM - 10:00 AM), a café serving traditional Moroccan pastries and coffee
- Visit Marrakech Zoo (10:30 AM - 12:00 PM), a zoo featuring a wide variety of animals from around the world
- Travel time to the next location: approximately 15 minutes

### Afternoon (12:00 PM - 5:00 PM)
- Lunch at Le Grand Café (1:00 PM - 2:30 PM), a restaurant serving French-inspired cuisine in a historic setting
- Visit Majorelle Garden's Botanical Garden (3:00 PM - 4:30 PM), a garden featuring an impressive collection of plants and flowers
- Travel time to the next location: approximately 10 minutes

### Evening (5:00 PM - 10:00 PM)
- Dinner at Restaurant Le Tobsyat (7:00 PM - 8:30 PM), a restaurant serving traditional Moroccan cuisine in a cozy setting
- Watch the sunset at Place Hassan II (9:00 PM - 10:00 PM), a public square with stunning views of the Atlas Mountains

## Practical Information

### Recommended Accommodations
- Hotel La Sultana Marrakech, a luxurious hotel located in the heart of the medina
- Riad Yacout, a boutique riad offering traditional Moroccan decor and cozy amenities
- Ibis Marrakech Bab Doukkala, a budget-friendly hotel with modern amenities

### Transportation Options
- Public transportation: use bus number 26 to travel between attractions
- Taxi: approximately 100 MAD (10 USD) for short trips
- Rental car: available at various locations throughout the city

### Estimated Costs
- Accommodations: 2,000 MAD (200 USD) per night for a family room
- Meals: 500 MAD (50 USD) per meal for a family of four
- Attractions: 100 MAD (10 USD) per person for most attractions
- Transportation: 100 MAD (10 USD) per trip for taxis or public transportation

Note: Prices are estimates and may vary depending on the season and availability.
